cycloneMessage.issuingUnit: NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
cycloneMessage.systemGeoRefPt1: ABOUT 1105 MI...1780 KM SW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP1 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Hurricane Fernanda Advisory Number 13 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP062017 800 PM PDT Fri Jul 14 2017
...FERNANDA CONTINUING TO STRENGTHEN...
SUMMARY OF 800 PM PDT...0300 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...10.7N 120.8W ABOUT 1105 MI...1780 KM SW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...145 MPH...230 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...W OR 270 DEGREES AT 12 MPH...19 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...947 MB...27.97 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 800 PM PDT (0300 UTC), the eye of Hurricane Fernanda was located near latitude 10.7 North, longitude 120.8 West. Fernanda is moving toward the west near 12 mph (19 km/h). A turn toward the west-northwest is expected on Saturday, and this motion is expected to continue on Sunday.
Maximum sustained winds have increased to near 145 mph (230 km/h) with higher gusts. Fernanda is a category 4 hurricane on the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Wind Scale. Some additional strengthening is possible tonight. After that, little change in strength is expected through Sunday.
Hurricane-force winds extend outward up to 30 miles (45 km) from the center and tropical-storm-force winds extend outward up to 70 miles (110 km).
The estimated minimum central pressure is 947 mb (27.97 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- None
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 200 AM PDT.
$$ Forecaster Beven
NNNN
